intro: Leea heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf leea, is a tropical flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Leeaceae and is characterized by its diverse leaf shapes, which vary depending on environmental conditions. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its small, fragrant white or yellow flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in tropical gardens.
